titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5053) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to prohibit the Secretary of the Treasury from requiring that the identity of contributors to 501(c) organizations be included in annual returns; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5293) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2017, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5053) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to prohibit the Secretary of the Treasury from requiring that the identity of contributors to 501(c) organizations be included in annual returns; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5293) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2017, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-621, by Mr. Stivers.
The resolution provides for 1 hour of general debate on both bills.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 124.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 778.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 236 - 171 (Roll no. 299).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 239 - 179 (Roll no. 300).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5053) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to prohibit the Secretary of the Treasury from requiring that the identity of contributors to 501(c) organizations be included in annual returns; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5293) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2017.
